newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs lower, sentiment weakened by rise in stocks.
newsitem.headline: JGBs lower, sentiment weakened by rise in stocks.

text.p: The key June 10-year Japanese government bond futures contract was slightly lower in early morning trade on Friday, due to firmness in Tokyo share prices, traders said.

The upside for JGBs is likely to be limited due to selling pressure from brokers who are still holding the new 196th 10-year JGBs offered by the Ministry of Finance (MOF) through an auction on Wednesday, a regional bank trader said.
Traders said the coupon rate of the two-year notes to be offered through a MOF auction this morning is likely to be set at one percent.
June JGBs stood at 123.73 as of 0053 GMT, down from the previous day's close of 123.88.
The benchmark 182nd JGB yield stood at 2.575 percent, up from the previous day's close of 2.550 percent.
Brokers who have not been able to sell off their holdings of the new 196th 10-year JGB are likely to want to sell on the upside and this may drag down JGBs, the regional bank trader said.
Investors have been generally reluctant to buy the new 10-year issue after a sharp fall in JGBs after the auction on Wednesday, traders said.
If the coupon rate for the new two-year government notes is set at one percent, there should be healthy demand from investors, traders said.
Traders said the Finance Ministry is likely to offer 120 billion yen worth of one percent two-year government notes at its auction later today.
MOF's offer for the two-year notes is due at 10.30 a.m. (0130 GMT) and the results are due at 2.30 p.m. (0530 GMT).
